name: Great Wall of China
description: A series of fortifications made of various materials, built along the northern borders of China.
Originally constructed to protect against invasions and raids.
Stretching over 13,000 miles, it is the longest wall in the world.
Built by various Chinese dynasties over several centuries.
significance: Symbol of China's historical strength and unity.
Represents ancient military strategy and defensive architecture.
A UNESCO World Heritage Site and major tourist attraction.

name: Petra
description: An archaeological site famous for its rock-cut architecture and water conduit system.
Known as the 'Rose City' due to the color of the stone.
Features elaborate tombs and temples carved directly into the sandstone cliffs.
Was a major trading center in ancient times, linking trade routes.
significance: Important trading hub and cultural center.
Represents advanced engineering and architectural skills of the Nabateans.
A UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the New Seven Wonders of the World.

name: Christ the Redeemer
description: A colossal statue of Jesus Christ in Rio de Janeiro, known for its iconic pose and panoramic views.
Standing 98 feet tall with arms stretching 92 feet wide.
Constructed using reinforced concrete and soapstone.
Offers breathtaking views of the city and surrounding landscapes.
significance: Symbol of Christianity and peace.
An iconic landmark representing Rio de Janeiro and Brazil.
A UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the New Seven Wonders of the World.

name: Machu Picchu
description: An ancient Incan city set high in the Andes Mountains, renowned for its archaeological significance and stunning views.
Built using sophisticated dry-stone construction techniques.
Known for its terraced fields, temples, and palaces.
Discovered by Hiram Bingham in 1911.
significance: Cultural and spiritual center of the Inca Empire.
Represents the zenith of Inca architectural and engineering prowess.
A UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the New Seven Wonders of the World.

name: Chichen Itza
description: A large pre-Columbian archaeological site built by the Maya civilization, known for its pyramid of Kukulc√°n.
Features the El Castillo pyramid, used for astronomical and ritual purposes.
Includes the Great Ball Court, the largest and best-preserved of its kind.
Known for its impressive and complex Maya architectural style.
significance: Important center for Maya culture and astronomy.
Demonstrates the advanced knowledge of the Maya in mathematics and astronomy.
A UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the New Seven Wonders of the World.

name: Roman Colosseum
description: An ancient amphitheater in Rome, famous for its grandeur and historical significance as a site of gladiatorial combat.
Could hold up to 80,000 spectators.
Features a complex system of vaults and arches.
Used for gladiatorial contests, public spectacles, and theatrical performances.
significance: Symbol of Roman engineering and gladiatorial games.
Represents the social and cultural life of ancient Rome.
A UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the New Seven Wonders of the World.

name: Taj Mahal
description: A white marble mausoleum built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal.
Features intricate marble inlay work and a large dome.
Surrounded by lush gardens and reflecting pools.
Construction took approximately 22 years and involved thousands of artisans.
significance: Symbol of love and Mughal architecture.
Represents the peak of Mughal architecture and artistry.
A UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the New Seven Wonders of the World.
